job_title: Fleet Data Management Customer Data Analyst
job_description: Date Posted:2025-11-13Country:United States of AmericaLocation:PW100: East Hartford 400 Main Street, East Hartford, CT, 06118 USAPosition Role Type:OnsiteU.S. Citizen, U.S. Person, or Immigration Status Requirements: U.S. citizenship is required, as only U.S. citizens are authorized to access information under this program/contract.Security Clearance: None/Not RequiredPratt & Whitney is working to once again transform the future of flight—designing, building and servicing engines unlike any the world has ever seen. And because transformation begins from within, we’re seeking the people to drive it.So, calling all curious. Come ready to explore and you’ll find a place where your talent takes flight—beyond the borders of title, a country or your comfort zone. Bring your passion and commitment and we’ll welcome you into a tight-knit team that takes our mission personally. Channel your drive to make a difference into shaping an organization and an industry that’s evolving fast to the future.At Pratt & Whitney, the difference you make is on display every day. Just look up. Are you ready to go beyond?The F135 Sustainment Data Management and Analytics (SDMA) organization supports Sustainment contracts for the F135 engine which powers the F-35 Joint Strike Fighter and has a rare opportunity for entry-level position into a highly skilled data professional team in support of F135 depot part inductions.This position of F135 Fleet Data Management Customer Data Analyst will support the full-history reconciliation of accurate propulsion system data into the Pratt and Whitney Fleet and Inventory Management Systems. Working cross-functionally within F135 Sustainment and in partnership with field service personnel and maintenance management groups is critical to team success.What You Will DoAs the F135 Fleet Data Management Customer Data Analyst, you will be responsible for ensuring that data is aligned across multiple platforms and that transactional data in the system of record reflects all available content. You will be responsible for performing data quality reviews of the fleet status vs. maintenance task limits, review individual assets when exception handling is required, and coordinate resources for and actively execute reconciliation of the data.You will be a key contributor to the concept of accurate data representing the quality documentation for key military engine hardware. Safety, Data Quality, and enabling the Customer to Defend Freedom are your key deliverables.Monitor lifing reports for late or missed tasks and monitor Electronic Equipment Logbook (EEL) deliveries from LDM to P&W for exception handling requirements.Identify areas for automation within our systems, processes, and tools and assist with development of new processes and tools that improve the way we perform tasks.Ensure proactive availability of reconciled lifing data for Module and LRU repair value streams.Perform data quality checks/corrections when returned EEL data fails as well as perform data quality reviews for depot inductions, pre-test configuration and post-test usage updates.Execute and deliver data quality metrics as required as well as Attend depot level meetings/working groups/capacity reviews as needed. Perform other data quality reviews as assigned.Qualifications You Must HaveBachelor’s degree in Engineering, Data Analytics/Management, Systems Engineering, Logistics, Operations Management, Communications or Associates Degree with 3 years engine management experience, or 6 years aviation maintenance experience with at least 3 years of that engine data management2 years of Data Analytics, Quality, Engineering, Maintenance or Operations experienceU.S. citizenship is required, as only U.S. citizens are authorized to access information under this program/contractQualifications We PreferExperience with MS VBA, Java, Python, or AI/MLFamiliarity with Jet EnginesDepot Level Maintenance conceptsSAP/JILES/Maintenix knowledgeConfiguration management skillsWhat Is My Role Type?In addition to transforming the future of flight, we are also transforming how and where we work. We’ve introduced role types to help you understand how you will operate in our blended work environment. This role is:Onsite: Employees who are working in Onsite roles will work primarily onsite. This includes all production and maintenance workers, as they are essential to the development of our engines.Candidates will learn more about role type and current site status throughout the recruiting process. For onsite and hybrid roles, commuting to and from the assigned site is the employee’s personal responsibility.As part of our commitment to maintaining a secure hiring process, candidates may be asked to attend select steps of the interview process in-person at one of our office locations, regardless of whether the role is designated as on-site, hybrid or remote.The salary range for this role is 66,000 USD - 130,000 USD. The salary range provided is a good faith estimate representative of all experience levels. RTX considers several factors when extending an offer, including but not limited to, the role, function and associated responsibilities, a candidate’s work experience, location, education/training, and key skills.Hired applicants may be eligible for benefits, including but not limited to, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short-term disability, long-term disability, 401(k) match, flexible spending accounts, flexible work schedules, employee assistance program, Employee Scholar Program, parental leave, paid time off, and holidays. Specific benefits are dependent upon the specific business unit as well as whether or not the position is covered by a collective-bargaining agreement.Hired applicants may be eligible for annual short-term and/or long-term incentive compensation programs depending on the level of the position and whether or not it is covered by a collective-bargaining agreement. Payments under these annual programs are not guaranteed and are dependent upon a variety of factors including, but not limited to, individual performance, business unit performance, and/or the company’s performance.This role is a U.S.-based role. If the successful candidate resides in a U.S. territory, the appropriate pay structure and benefits will apply.RTX anticipates the application window closing approximately 40 days from the date the notice was posted. However, factors such as candidate flow and business necessity may require RTX to shorten or extend the application window.RTX is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or veteran status, or any other applicable state or federal protected class. RTX provides affirmative action in employment for qualified Individuals with a Disability and Protected Veterans in compliance with Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act and the Vietnam Era Veterans’ Readjustment Assistance Act. Since 1869, we've connected people through food they love. We’re proud to be stewards of amazing brands that people trust. Our portfolio includes the iconic Campbell’s brand, as well as Cape Cod, Chunky, Goldfish, Kettle Brand, Lance, Late July, Pacific Foods, Pepperidge Farm, Prego, Pace, Rao’s Homemade, Snack Factory, Snyder’s of Hanover. Swanson, and V8. Here, you will make a difference every day. You will be supported to build a rewarding career with opportunities to grow, innovate and inspire. Make history with us.Why Campbell’s…Benefits begin on day one and include medical, dental, short and long-term disability, AD&D, and life insurance (for individual, families, and domestic partners).Employees are eligible for our matching 401(k) plan and can enroll on the first day of employment with immediate vesting.Campbell’s offers unlimited sick time along with paid time off and holiday pay.If in WHQ – free access to the fitness center. Access to on-site day care (operated by Bright Horizons) and company store.Giving back to the communities where our employees work and live is very important to Campbell’s. Our “Campbell’s Cares” program matches employee donations and/or volunteer activity up to $1,500 annually.Campbell’s has a variety of Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) to support employees.How you will make history...In this dual role within the Research and Development team at Campbell’s Meals and Beverages, the Packaging Engineer - Sustainability plays a key role in advancing enterprise packaging sustainability while supporting core package development initiatives. The position is responsible for the support, development, and communication of enterprise packaging sustainability activities. In addition to sustainability efforts, the Packaging Engineer develops and implements packaging solutions for Campbell’s brands across primary, secondary, and tertiary formats.What you will do…SustainabilityData & Reporting: Support collection, validation, and analysis of packaging sustainability data for Campbell’s Corporate Responsibility Report, customer requests, and external reporting programs (e.g., Walmart Gigaton, THESIS). Partner with IT and Digitalization to enhance data systems and reporting processes.Coalition & Industry Engagement: Represent Campbell’s in coalitions, conferences, and industry events to stay informed on emerging policies and innovations. Maintain and evaluate memberships, share insights with Packaging R&D leadership, and identify new collaboration opportunities.Sustainability Programs & Tools: Lead packaging support for the How2Recycle program, including monitoring updates, training team members, and guiding compliance. Manage Life Cycle Assessment (LCA) requests and conduct annual benchmarking to assess industry trends and performance.Cross-Functional Collaboration: Meet regularly with packaging category teams to align on design-for-recyclability principles, public commitments, and policy mandates. Partner with cross-functional stakeholders (including Procurement, Legal, Regulatory, and Corporate Responsibility) to advance enterprise goals and compliance.Communications & Progress Tracking: Track progress toward sustainability goals and commitments, summarize insights for leadership, and support internal and external communications highlighting Campbell’s packaging sustainability achievements.Packaging DevelopmentDevelops and implements packaging solutions supporting new product launches, continuous quality improvements, and cost savings initiatives.Provides technical thought leadership for the role of packaging to project teams, demonstrating an understanding of cost drivers, material properties, equipment capabilities, customer requirements, and consumer interaction.Apply the principles of data management, statistics, and experimental design to determine, execute, and document test plans.Collaborates with Campbell’s internal cross-functional teams, as well as with external vendors and manufacturing facilities.Troubleshoot issues that arise during assessment, feasibility, development, and commercialization with some manager supervision, implementing and executing the plan of action.Collaborates to help identify new approaches, processes, and best practices.Travel (about 20%) required. This is often associated with visits to manufacturing plants, vendors, and conferences. A significant portion of the job is in a normal office environment.Who you will work with...This role partners with a wide variety of cross-functional partners, including Corporate Responsibility & Sustainability, Legal, Regulatory, Government Affairs, Marketing, and Supply Chain to advance enterprise goals, ensure compliance with emerging regulations, and develop packaging solutions. Strong communication, organization, and project management skills are essential to manage multiple initiatives effectively. The position reports to the Manager of Packaging- Sustainability.What you bring to the table…Bachelor's Degree, preferably in Materials Science, Packaging, or related field.6+ months of experience in Packaging R&D roles, including Co-op or Internship experience.It would be great to have…A strong passion and interest in packaging sustainabilityStrong communication and written skills.Experience with packaging development software desired (TOPS or CAPE), specification database management, and MS Office.Able to develop a development and implementation plan for low-moderate risk projects using sound technical methodology.Self-starter with the ability to drive technical solutions forward and multitask on key programs/projects.Ability to identify and conduct appropriate tests to simulate the distribution environment.Compensation and Benefits:The target base salary range for this full-time, salaried position is between $75,400-$108,400Individual base pay depends on work location and additional factors such as experience, job-related skills, and relevant education or training. Total pay may include other forms of compensation. In addition, we offer competitive health, dental, 401k and wellness benefits beginning on the first day of employment. Please ask your Talent Acquisition Partner for more information about our total rewards package.The Company is committed to providing equal opportunity for employees and qualified applicants in all aspects of the employment relationship, including consideration for employment, without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, marital status, protected veteran status, disability, age, religion, or any other classification protected by law.
